   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between six Diameter nodes connected as follows.
   23: %%
   24: %%                  ---- SERVER.REALM1  (TLS after capabilities exchange)
   25: %%                /
   26: %%               /  ---- SERVER.REALM2  (ditto)
   27: %%              | /
   28: %%   CLIENT.REALM0 ----- SERVER.REALM3  (no security)
   29: %%              | \
   30: %%               \  ---- SERVER.REALM4  (TLS at connection establishment)
   31: %%                \
   32: %%                  ---- SERVER.REALM5  (ditto)
   33: %%
   34: 
   35: -module(diameter_tls_SUITE).
   36: 
   37: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   38: -export([run/0]).
   39: 
   40: %% common_test wrapping
   41: -export([suite/0,
   42:          all/0,
   43:          init_per_suite/1,
   44:          end_per_suite/1,
   45:          parallel/1]).
   46: 
   47: %% diameter callbacks
   48: -export([prepare_request/3,
   49:          prepare_retransmit/3,
   50:          handle_answer/4,
   51:          handle_request/3]).
   52: 
   53: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   54: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
   55: 
   56: %% ===========================================================================
   57: 
   58: -define(util, diameter_util).
   59: 
   60: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   61: 
   62: -define(CLIENT,  "CLIENT.REALM0").
   63: -define(SERVER1, "SERVER.REALM1").
   64: -define(SERVER2, "SERVER.REALM2").
   65: -define(SERVER3, "SERVER.REALM3").
   66: -define(SERVER4, "SERVER.REALM4").
   67: -define(SERVER5, "SERVER.REALM5").
   68: 
   69: -define(SERVERS, [?SERVER1, ?SERVER2, ?SERVER3, ?SERVER4, ?SERVER5]).
   70: 
   71: -define(DICT_COMMON,  ?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON).
   72: 
   73: -define(APP_ALIAS, the_app).
   74: -define(APP_ID, ?DICT_COMMON:id()).
   75: 
   76: -define(NO_INBAND_SECURITY, 0).
   77: -define(TLS, 1).
   78: 
   79: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   80: -define(SERVICE(Host, Dict),
   81:         [{'Origin-Host', Host},
   82:          {'Origin-Realm', realm(Host)},
   83:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   84:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   85:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   86:          {'Inband-Security-Id', [?NO_INBAND_SECURITY]},
   87:          {'Auth-Application-Id', [Dict:id()]},
   88:          {application, [{alias, ?APP_ALIAS},
   89:                         {dictionary, Dict},
   90:                         {module, #diameter_callback{peer_up = false,
   91:                                                     peer_down = false,
   92:                                                     pick_peer = false,
   93:                                                     handle_error = false,
   94:                                                     default = ?MODULE}},
   95:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
   96: 
   97: %% Config for diameter:add_transport/2. In the listening case, listen
   98: %% on a free port that we then lookup using the implementation detail
   99: %% that diameter_tcp registers the port with diameter_reg.
  100: -define(CONNECT(PortNr, Caps, Opts),
  101:         {connect, [{transport_module, diameter_tcp},
  102:                    {transport_config, [{raddr, ?ADDR},
  103:                                        {rport, PortNr},
  104:                                        {ip, ?ADDR},
  105:                                        {port, 0}
  106:                                        | Opts]},
  107:                    {capabilities, Caps}]}).
  108: -define(LISTEN(Caps, Opts),
  109:         {listen, [{transport_module, diameter_tcp},
  110:                   {transport_config, [{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | Opts]},
  111:                   {capabilities, Caps}]}).
  112: 
  113: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
  114: -define(LOGOUT, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  115: 
  116: %% ===========================================================================
  117: %% common_test wrapping
  118: 
  119: suite() ->
  120:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 90}}].
  121: 
  122: all() ->
  123:     [parallel].
  124: 
  125: %% Shouldn't really have to know about crypto here but 'ok' from
  126: %% ssl:start() isn't enough to guarantee that TLS is available.
  127: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  128:     try
  129:         [] == (catch make_certs(dir(Config)))
  130:             orelse throw({?MODULE, no_certs}),
  131:         ok == application:start(crypto) orelse throw({?MODULE, no_crypto}),
  132:         ok == ssl:start() orelse throw({?MODULE, no_ssl}),
  133:         Config
  134:     catch
  135:         {?MODULE, E} ->
  136:             {skip, E}
  137:     end.
  138: 
  139: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  140:     ssl:stop(),
  141:     application:stop(crypto).
  142: 
  143: parallel(Config) ->
  144:     run(dir(Config), false).
  145: 
  146: dir(Config) ->
  147:     proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
  148: 
  149: %% ===========================================================================
  150: 
  151: run() ->
  152:     Tmp = ?util:mktemp("diameter_tls"),
  153:     try
  154:         run(Tmp, true)
  155:     after
  156:         file:del_dir_r(Tmp)
  157:     end.
  158: 
  159: run(Dir, B) ->
  160:     application:start(crypto),
  161:     ssl:start(),
  162:     try
  163:         ?util:run([{[fun traffic/2, Dir, B], 60000}])
  164:     after
  165:         diameter:stop(),
  166:         ssl:stop(),
  167:         application:stop(crypto)
  168:     end.
  169: 
  170: traffic(Dir, true) ->
  171:     [] = make_certs(Dir),
  172:     traffic(Dir, false);
  173: 
  174: traffic(Dir, false) ->
  175:     ok = diameter:start(),
  176:     Servers = start_services(Dir),
  177:     Connections = add_transports(Dir, Servers),
  178:     [] = ?util:run([[fun call/1, S] || S <- ?util:scramble(?SERVERS)]),
  179:     [] = remove_transports(Connections),
  180:     [] = stop_services().
  181: 
  182: make_certs(Dir) ->
  183:     ?util:run([[fun make_cert/2, Dir, B] || B <- ["server1",
  184:                                                   "server2",
  185:                                                   "server4",
  186:                                                   "server5",
  187:                                                   "client"]]).
  188: 
  189: start_services(Dir) ->
  190:     Servers = [{S, {_,_} = server(S, sopts(S, Dir))} || S <- ?SERVERS],
  191:     ok = diameter:start_service(?CLIENT, ?SERVICE(?CLIENT, ?DICT_COMMON)),
  192:     Servers.
  193: 
  194: add_transports(Dir, Servers) ->
  195:     true = diameter:subscribe(?CLIENT),
  196:     Opts = ssl_options(Dir, "client"),
  197:     [{N, S, connect(?CLIENT, S, copts(N, Opts))} || {N,S} <- Servers].
  198: 
  199: %% Remove the client transports and expect the corresponding server
  200: %% transport to go down.
  201: remove_transports(Connections) ->
  202:     [] = [T || S <- ?SERVERS, T <- [diameter:subscribe(S)], T /= true],
  203:     [] = ?util:run([[fun disconnect/1, T] || T <- Connections]),
  204:     [S || S <- ?SERVERS,
  205:           I <- [receive #diameter_event{service = S, info = I} -> I end],
  206:           down /= catch element(1, I)].
  207: 
  208: disconnect({_, {_LRef, _PortNr}, CRef}) ->
  209:     ok = diameter:remove_transport(?CLIENT, CRef).
  210: 
  211: stop_services() ->
  212:     [{H,T} || H <- [?CLIENT | ?SERVERS],
  213:               T <- [diameter:stop_service(H)],
  214:               T /= ok].
  215: 
  216: %% ===========================================================================
  217: %% diameter callbacks
  218: 
  219: %% prepare_request/3
  220: 
  221: prepare_request(#diameter_packet{msg = Req},
  222:                 ?CLIENT,
  223:                 {_Ref, Caps}) ->
  224:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  225:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  226:         = Caps,
  227: 
  228:     {send, set(Req, [{'Session-Id', diameter:session_id(OH)},
  229:                      {'Origin-Host',  OH},
  230:                      {'Origin-Realm', OR}])}.
  231: 
  232: %% prepare_retransmit/3
  233: 
  234: prepare_retransmit(_Pkt, false, _Peer) ->
  235:     discard.
  236: 
  237: %% handle_answer/4
  238: 
  239: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer) ->
  240:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  241:     Rec.
  242: 
  243: %% handle_request/3
  244: 
  245: handle_request(#diameter_packet{msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId}},
  246:                OH,
  247:                {_Ref, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH,_},
  248:                                      origin_realm = {OR, _}}})
  249:   when OH /= ?CLIENT ->
  250:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  251:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  252:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  253:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR}}.
  254: 
  255: %% ===========================================================================
  256: %% support functions
  257: 
  258: %% Send an STR intended for a specific server and expect success.
  259: call(Server) ->
  260:     Realm = realm(Server),
  261:     Req = ['STR', {'Destination-Realm', Realm},
  262:                   {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  263:                   {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}],
  264:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  265:                        'Origin-Host' = Server,
  266:                        'Origin-Realm' = Realm}
  267:         = call(Req, [{filter, realm}]).
  268: 
  269: call(Req, Opts) ->
  270:     diameter:call(?CLIENT, ?APP_ALIAS, Req, Opts).
  271: 
  272: set([H|T], Vs) ->
  273:     [H | Vs ++ T].
  274: 
  275: realm(Host) ->
  276:     tl(lists:dropwhile(fun(C) -> C /= $. end, Host)).
  277: 
  278: inband_security(Ids) ->
  279:     [{'Inband-Security-Id', Ids}].
  280: 
  281: ssl_options(Dir, Base) ->
  282:     Root = filename:join([Dir, Base]),
  283:     [{ssl_options, [{verify, verify_none},{certfile, Root ++ "_ca.pem"},
  284:                     {keyfile,  Root ++ "_key.pem"}]}].
  285: 
  286: make_cert(Dir, Base) ->
  287:     make_cert(Dir, Base ++ "_key.pem", Base ++ "_ca.pem").
  288: 
  289: make_cert(Dir, Keyfile, Certfile) ->
  290:     [KP,CP] = [filename:join([Dir, F]) || F <- [Keyfile, Certfile]],
  291: 
  292:     KC = join(["openssl genrsa -out", KP, "2048"]),
  293:     CC = join(["openssl req -new -sha256 -x509 -key", KP, "-out", CP, "-days 7",
  294:                "-subj /C=SE/ST=./L=Stockholm/CN=www.erlang.org"]),
  295: 
  296:     %% Hope for the best and only check that files are written.
  297:     KR = os:cmd(KC),
  298:     {_, {ok, _}} = {KR, file:read_file_info(KP)},
  299:     CR = os:cmd(CC),
  300:     {_, {ok, _}} = {CR, file:read_file_info(CP)},
  301: 
  302:     {KP,CP}.
  303: 
  304: join(Strs) ->
  305:     string:join(Strs, " ").
  306: 
  307: %% server/2
  308: 
  309: server(Host, {Caps, Opts}) ->
  310:     ok = diameter:start_service(Host, ?SERVICE(Host, ?DICT_COMMON)),
  311:     {ok, LRef} = diameter:add_transport(Host, ?LISTEN(Caps, Opts)),
  312:     {LRef, hd([_] = ?util:lport(tcp, LRef))}.
  313: 
  314: sopts(?SERVER1, Dir) ->
  315:     {inband_security([?TLS]),
  316:      ssl_options(Dir, "server1")};
  317: sopts(?SERVER2, Dir) ->
  318:     {inband_security([?NO_INBAND_SECURITY, ?TLS]),
  319:      ssl_options(Dir, "server2")};
  320: sopts(?SERVER3, _) ->
  321:     {[], []};
  322: sopts(?SERVER4, Dir) ->
  323:     {[], ssl(ssl_options(Dir, "server4"))};
  324: sopts(?SERVER5, Dir) ->
  325:     {[], ssl(ssl_options(Dir, "server5"))}.
  326: 
  327: ssl([{ssl_options = T, Opts}]) ->
  328:     [{T, true} | Opts].
  329: 
  330: %% connect/3
  331: 
  332: connect(Host, {_LRef, PortNr}, {Caps, Opts}) ->
  333:     {ok, Ref} = diameter:add_transport(Host, ?CONNECT(PortNr, Caps, Opts)),
  334:     {up, Ref, _, _, #diameter_packet{}}
  335:          = receive
  336:                #diameter_event{service = Host, info = Info}
  337:                  when element(2, Info) == Ref ->
  338:                    Info
  339:            end,
  340:     Ref.
  341: 
  342: copts(S, Opts)
  343:   when S == ?SERVER1;
  344:        S == ?SERVER2;
  345:        S == ?SERVER3 ->
  346:     {inband_security([?NO_INBAND_SECURITY, ?TLS]), Opts};
  347: copts(S, Opts)
  348:   when S == ?SERVER4;
  349:        S == ?SERVER5 ->
  350:     {[], ssl(Opts)}.
